settings.name: Distance buffer (in meters)
settings.description: Specify the buffer distance between the animal and the feature to use for evaluating barrier behaviours. Be careful to consider how this distance might vary for different species.

settings.name: Maximum time for short encounter events (in hours)
settings.description: Specify the maximum duration of an encounter event that would be considered a short 'bounce' or 'quick cross' event. This value must be at least 2x the fix interval of the tracking data to identify 'quick cross' events, and at least 3x the fix interval to identify 'bounce' events.

settings.name: Minimum time for 'trapped' encounter events (in hours)
settings.description: Specify the minimum duration of an encounter event for which the animal would be considered to be in a 'trapped' condition. Take into account the fix interval of the tracking data.

settings.name: Buffer time around encounter events (in hours)
settings.description: Specify the length of time `w` around the encounter event over which to calculate average movement straightness using a moving window. These calculations will include all locations within `w/2` before the first location of the encounter event and `w/2` after the last location of the event.

settings.name: Feature shapefile
settings.description: Optionally, upload a shapefile containing linear features to use for the barrier intersection behaviour analysis. Make sure that they overlap with the tracking data and are in WGS84 projection! The App requires the following files, named exactly as given: 1. `roads.cpg`, 2. `roads.dbf`, 3. `roads.prj`, 4. `roads.shp`, 5. `roads.shx`. Note that fallback road files are provided, but they span only the Yukon to Yellowstone Region (Y2Y).
